_comment: Created by EFisher on 03/12/2015 13:07:02 using v2.7
title: Public Health England, National Drug Treatment Monitoring System
analysis_commentary: Alcohol consumption is a contributing factor to hospital admissions and deaths from a diverse range of conditions. There were over one million hospital admissions related to alcohol in 2009/10, so reducing alcohol abuse through successful treatment can help reduce this. The proportion of service users who had completed alcohol treatment successfully was 59% in 2013/14, this is a nine per cent increase from 48% in 2009/10.
data_source: Public Health England, National Drug Treatment Monitoring System
